umtfzUCIiVpj2GGrr6lexA.text: This place is always packed to the rafters whenever I walk past so one day we thought we'd give it a try, but we were so disappointed. A good crepe should be delicate, light and melt-in-the-mouth, but at Café Crêperie they're huge, crispy, folded over monster pancakes, browning on the outside rather than a nice golden yellow. I was surprised at this as the chefs were French, the waitresses were French... so why weren't the crepe? The huge choice of fillings, both savory and sweet are tasty, I had Tortiflette, a traditional bacon, potato, raclette cheese, onion, white wine and cream filled one, but the whole crepe was far too heavy and none of us particularly enjoyed the result. The small selection of wines are OK, all are fairly inoffensive so they don't impede the already strong flavour of the crepe.I really didn't like the interior either, it's a cheap caff style, with throw away table clothes and a constant queue of people who they let loiter about in the door way waiting for a table, which is rather off putting as it's only a small restaurant and when I was there they were actually standing next to the tables. Plus because of  the door constantly opening and closing there actually flies buzzing around! The music is from a radio at the back and if your sat further in it's so awful to be subjected to it blaring out. As the kitchen is a small counter in the dining area you come out smelling like an over done crepe yourself! The waitresses are also rude and it lacks any Parisian charm whatsoever.I can't understand why people rave about this place! For me, it's getting nuls points.

photos.caption: Photo of Kensington Creperie - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Kensington Creperie - London, United Kingdom

oztttHxFQ7IEr2Vg0KgkDg.text: For an indulgence under £10, I go to The Kensington Creperie. This small café is well-know in Kensington for their crapes that practically melt in your mouth! Once I tried the Italian crape, I was hooked! This delight contains mozzarella cheese, tomatoes, basil and a special Italian sauce.They also have wonderful sweet crapes too! For example, you can find specials like cream cheese and strawberry preserves, or just apple, cinnamon and raisin. All of the recipes

photos.caption: Photo of Kensington Creperie - London, United Kingdom

wKo2NMEDSmXnLJjt6U2kuQ.text: I can recommend the delicious and authentic crepes at this tiny little South Kensington cafe. The space is so small that you tend to bang tables with your neighbours. Service too, can be slightly chaotic on the busy days when queues can snake out the door.But thats a good sign too, right?Once you get in, try the real Breton cider - strong, rich, dark and delicously different to the sweet fizzy commercial and the flat dry Somerset versions. Among the crepes, there is a bewilderingly vast choice on the menu, as well as daily specials up on the boards. The one I usually end up going for is the Buckwheat Gallette with champignon (creamy mushrooms), cheese and ham. There are plenty of choices for vegetarians, but coeliacs, dairy-free and vegans might have more trouble.

photos.caption: Photo of Kensington Creperie - London, United Kingdom. Cafe Creperie

co8BtdMqhQp1ezZwDkN1bQ.text: Very disappointed. The crepes were dry and not tasty enough. I am French and a bit picky on my crepes but I was expecting better from this place. I took a 4 cheeses crepe the crepe itself was dry crispy on the side when it shouldn't be and tasteless. The ingredients of the crepe so the 4 different kind of cheeses were really nice and that's the only reason why I enjoyed it a little bit.

ESbAIs5Y7PV0Gf43LHz_1w.text: The crepes are good, the sweet ones are great. The service is just okay. The atmosphere inside is small and crowded, not very nice. I enjoy this place in the spring and summer, as the location is wonderful. Sitting outside is very nice. I had a sweet crepe with bananas & rum last summer, still thinking about it today. Very good.

hhosICBDuAaY-cR4iHlMyw.text: Can't recommend this place. The crepes took forever to come. Savory ones are way too salty and dry. On top of it they are way too expansive. Try to avoid it if you can.

pWMrz8s2gi8Z3IH43zPYsg.text: Had two sweet crepes between my friend and I~loved both!  Thought the service was good.  Our food arrived hot and fresh and decadently delicious.  Price was reasonable for the area.  I'd definitely go back.

4Sw5HNBi1noeF3NPJCCXqA.text: The crepes were tasty and you cannot beat the location, but it was a tourist trap.  We hate to admit we were caught in it!  The staff provided the bare minimum of service making sure your food made it to the table, but don't expect much more.

a2KsU7vSmYx1_4WhhYihPw.text: Nice place. Nothing mind blowing. Nothing bad. Nice place to eat outside when the weather is good.

VxoB-0vsHFbdf8yOg-qqQQ.text: BEST CREPES EVER!!!!!!!!! I ordered a strawberry and nutella chocolate one and it was... AMAZING!!!!!

WHTTLTGLrO6Tsye6QviVeA.text: Four of us went to the Kensington Creperie for lunch...and we were actually sad when we finished! The selection of savoury crepes was a unique and curious lot with an international flair to fit any taste! I had the chicken and mushroom but not just any chicken and mushroom...a pepper cheese and cream with garlic infusion made this a party for the taste buds. After we had our crepes and washed down with a very nice crisp sav. blanc for £13.50 a bottle, we went onto the homemade ice cream and the sweet crepes! The toffee, banana, coconut crepe was a flavour sensation. Good news too...they are opening a new creperie on Dean street in Soho tomorrow or Tuesday! HUZZAH! The staff are friendly and attentive and really were thankful for our custom which they will get many more times!

4kQPfcq22I3tFZylG1OoRg.text: Tasty, tasty, tasty crepes and galettes!I went here for dessert after having eaten at the Oriental Canteen more or less next door. The venue has very much a café feel to it, not at all pretentious, and slightly worn at the edges. The service is prompt although perhaps slightly perfunctory, but the crepes themselves are delicious. Beware if you order the Normandie with the Calvados... my mouth was nearly blown apart by the "rather generous dash" that had laden the centre of my crepe!Haven't tried the savoury crepes yet, but I'd imagine they'll be good too!

L_zekqeXlfzMpeZTVYWSFQ.text: I had a mushroom crepe which tasted like nothing. And a nuttela crepe which was leather hard. Service was decent. Very cramped space.

KAufwImvS_oS8PPS5uu3AA.text: Mmmmm how I miss this place!   This is just down the street from where I lived the year I spent abroad in college. Everyone in our house gained a few pounds from our constant stops here! Of course I haven't eaten there recently, but if it's anything like what it used to be---crispy on the outside, warm and gooey on the inside---I'm sure it's still amazing. Can't wait to go back for a visit!They can be kind of messy and difficult to eat in those paper take away cones, so I suggest eating at the cafe.

lGLGnybIDmJRnp4LRUyVrg.text: Wow, best crepes ever. The crepes themselves are crispy and freshly made, and they are filled generously with whatever you ordered (and some more). I have to stop converting prices into USD, but in any case, the price range of their crepes was between £6.00 and £10.00 (at least for the savory ones). I tried the spicy tandoori chicken crepe (£7.75), which was fun to eat. (What can I say? I like trying foods that are familiar to me except in an unfamiliar form.) There was also some courgette (i.e., zucchini, if you're an American) mixed in there. I tasted some of the chicken mushroom crepe (£7.95) and the chicken and pepperoni crepe (£7.95), both of which were tasty, but I think you have to be open-minded about your crepe tasting like a pizza for the latter one.The verdict: I must return after an outing to V&A or Hyde Park and try a sweet crepe.

GZEPaLJlpDbFIfnDEV9-Mw.text: Quite pricey for the modest size of Crepe served here but a really big range of sweet and savoury flavours (despite its tiny size), and it is delicious at the end of the day, sometimes it does attract a small queue. Conveniently located, consistently polite, fast and friendly service.

HQ_C3FFn1A61tl-XfsCzBw.text: The perfect late afternoon treat.  Highly recommend the strawberries and cream or the toffee crepes with an espresso.  Friendly service.

lPQHkxrOMXsaZDFrTLVa5g.text: This restaurant is just off South Kensington tube station. This place is always packed with tourists and locals. The service is fast but staffs here are not very friendly. Wide selection of savoury and sweet crepes. The crepes are delicious served in decent portion.

AXIjeS-8SsqcjD_f-QhX8Q.text: Love this café and come here whenever I am in the area for a crepe. I used to live in France and ate crepes on a regular basis, this is the closest to the original I have found in London. Staff are not always friendly as a previous commenter said, however service is usually quick.

X2nhBrSx3LY_cAX9gmFpUg.text: This charming cafe had a great selection of crepes, including specials written on the wall. They have their own ice creams as well which I would love to go back and try. A great people watching spot in south Kensington!

8_0wv-uRyb554PgFsEczbA.text: I had a bit of a tummy ache after this.  I was quite excited by the menu - lots of choice and the place was really busy too, which is a good sign...We shared a sweet crepe (almond and strawberry) as well as a savoury (veggie).   V impressed that there was a buckwheat option, and also that there are lots of fresh juices to pick from.  The taste of the crepes left something to be desired though. Overall, it was ok but slightly overpriced. Probs wouldn't return :(

xqm83bxKF-B2_zMSkWnu5Q.text: OMG, I want one of these in Pittsburgh. I have had 5 of the crepes from here - 3 sweet, 2 savory.Chicken and Mushroom - eh, not much taste.  It was the only one I could have done withoutPepperoni - really really good.Orange crepe suzette - very good, but not as 'sweet' as others.  There's one with pears and white chocolate and it was, by far, my favorite.There's one with berries and chocolate, and it was good.  I don't prefer fruit with my chocolate, but I imagine it would be fantastic for someone who does.I would come back, if I was ever in London again.

5WE2vF0NhhkJ8RC4mbtEEw.text: It's been a while since I was last here, but on a recent trip back to London it was top of my list of places to go eat.  It's in the same place though the surroundings have changed.  The street is under construction and they seem to have taken over the shop next door and turned it into an ice cream parlor.  Luckily Kensington Creperie hasn't changed that much.  I think it might be nicer inside, gentrifying along with the rest of the block.  But no worries, the food hasn't changed at all - and that's a good thing.The galettes are all under £10 and a meal within itself.  I couldn't resist the Tartiflette myself.  Don't forget to order a pichet (or more) of the house cider.  The perfect accompaniment to your galette.Staff was friendly and prompt.  Though most of them are French, they seem to have adapted to the English style of service (haha).  Food comes out really fast - good thing if you're hungry.  If you want to linger they won't rush you out the door though.

e3z0jsMZMJwKWy9ybv0SmA.text: Excellent well known Creperie in the area and very close to South Kensington Tube Station as well as walking distance from Harrods or The Victoria and Albert Museum.What I love is that they use the absolute freshest ingredients and the Crepes have the perfect texture and taste. They have dessert and savory crepes.Tried and Tested = Very Good - You should try if you are in the area:Strawberry Creme Crepe: Fresh strawberries, cream, white Belgian Chocolate, Chantilly Cream. La Superbe Banane Quebec: Banana, walnuts, butter, cream, with Maple Syrup poured all over, and a splash of Cointreau.The Mancara Chicken Crepe with peanuts is a meaty meal :)Cozy ambience and friendly service.TIPS:Come early, this place gets busy very quickly and usually has long lines.Good value for moneyBusiness Hours:Tuesday to Sunday 11.00am - 11.30pmMonday 12 midday - 11.30pmMilestone: 50th FTR!

photos.caption: Photo of Kensington Creperie - London, United Kingdom. From website

ca460YU_NVNsfcC9Dp2RBw.text: I really don't know what the deal is with this place.  I think its just overhyped and a bit of a tourist trap.I went for a savoury crepe - maybe thats where it went wrong?  Maybe the ice creams and sweet crepes are where its at, but I'm not tempted at all to go back and try the other items.  I tried the salmon and spinach and cheese crepe.  Sounded good, but oh-so-salty.  I think its just the Scottish salmon in general, as it is quite salty, so OK - can't fault them for that.  But there was a lot of spinach in there -  not fresh, but of the frozen kind.  The crepe itself was a bit of a soggy mess.  The 2 other diners thought it was great - a seafood crepe, and the other had Mona Liza, which had crispy bacon, mushrooms, spinach, cheese, and all this other good stuff.  "This is so good, Best thing ever, etc..." Extensive savoury and sweet crepe menu, yes.  All the items and different ingredients did get my mouth watering, yes.  All sounds great, but when you eat it - does it actually taste good?  I didn't feel like mine was very good.  I do wonder how the rest of the items fared.  Everything sounds amazing, but, I feel like its a bit of a trickery on the brain where people are in love w/ the idea of the ingredients, rather than how everything tastes altogether.  Anyhow, I wouldn't go back.  The service wasn't very good.  We were also asked to wait outside because it was small, which was fine.  But they let another couple wait inside, who were behind us, and they were being seated ahead of us.  It was a WTF moment for me because we had to wait quite a while, but the couple was nice and told the waiter that we were ahead of them.  This place wasn't horrible - nothing went terribly wrong.  But I'm giving it 1 star because there really is nothing here that I would come back for, as it just seems like a hyped up tourist trap.

IE_zeJkvjaUTpFUPhJnPeQ.text: I have mixed feelings about this place.  My wife and I had three crepes in total - the Chicken & Mushroom, the Superbe Coffee Crepe and Honey & Lemon.  My wife recommended the Chicken & Mushroom one as delicious.  But I was overwhelmed by the sweetness of the Superbe Coffee Crepe: I felt like I consumed a whole cup of condensed milk and white chocolate.  Maybe it's just best to share that one.We had a long time waiting for the Honey & Lemon crepe to arrive, and it was a bit too lemony for our liking.This place is popular.  It is in a prime location for all the tourists heading to the museums in the area.  The service and the prices were ok.

_QErM1OIn8lPgD2edNqt9g.text: I would highly recommend those wondering what to order to look up at the "Crepe Specials" board before ordering because a) They don't have it on their original menu (which has so many options you'll get dizzy just looking at it) & you never know when they'll stop making their scrumptious limited time specials!b) The sweet & savoury crepes I tried tonight from the Special Crepe board were both delicious.The server wasn't able to understand/speak English too fluently so it took a while to order, but I still had a great experience. Popeye - Savoury Crepe: juicy (yes juicy! Not dry!) chicken pieces, spinach (hence the name), goat cheese (I substituted mine with brie b/c I'm no fan of goat cheese), cheddar cheese & sundried tomatoes. The cheeses were perfectly melted, the ingredients complimented each other well and it was neither too salty/bland. Mmm... The spinach didn't leave that weird residue-ey feeling that some spinach/cheese crepes do back in the states! Strawberry Cheesecake - Sweet Crepe: Get it. You're daft to not get it if you like sweets, strawberries, cheesecake, belgian white chocolate, crumbled sweet biscuit and vanilla ice cream... or anything of the sort. So good. Blew all my stress away.It's a bit cramped inside, but there's seating outside if you don't mind the weather!Highly recommend this place if you want delicious crepes for a decent price.

piIjiXFEL5-L3TcJ8gfptw.text: My friend and I went there on a Sunday morning. Because it is super early and there was no one but us, the service and everything was quite good i guess. I wasnt expecting too much really for a restaurant like this which is so close to V&A and all the other museums. I ordered the english breakfast crepe and it was okay. I will say if i ever come to this area again in a super early morning i will choose to come here.

shCFPRpXioOqk-1mZ8G7iw.text: We were looking for a nice dessert, after suffering through an amazingly unspectacular lunch at another place. This restaurant is crowded with tables and chairs, but smells great...probably because it serves fresh crepes and gelato. I ordered a hazelnut crepe and my husband ordered a chocolate and banana crepe. They were served warm and gooey, with melted chocolate inside. VERY rich and decadent, but also really good!I also ordered a cappuccino, which was delicious with the rich dessert. The atmosphere is crowded and nothing special, but I thought the food, as a treat, was great.

FB463Bisz8ldK7eUZ5W_7A.text: This is such a brilliant place to eat!!!  I cant say enough great things.  I have been coming here forever, and it is well worth any waiting time.I will always stop in when I am in the area!!!

ADR7JU7PIXzzpNb8wOI2cg.text: Oh I miss this place! When I lived in S. Ken I frequented this place for crepes, obviously. When I felt savory, I had their tandoori chicken crepe. When I felt sweet, I had simple lemon and sugar. Since then I've never seen another place with tandoori chicken crepe on their menu or a place that served a better lemon sugar crepe.

rv2HVek5nEtMAizQ4LT0OA.text: Horrid HORRID HOOOOOORRRRRRRRIIIIIIIIID.Crepe was a chewy mess, chocolate filling was certainly not made from callebaut (or even melted York bar), and the ice-cream was some cheap creamless concoction -- probably a £ a gallon or less.How do you fuck up a crepe?  My wife is in the kitchen as we speak making crepes because we were so disappointed at Cafe Creperie and are now craving them more than ever.Tourists, eh?

UB2cTBlZi7B1zEj8OAPy5A.text: This is the perfect brunch place, although I have also been here for dinner and dessert (which was perfect as well).I never thought I would find savory crepes delicious, but the crepes here are perfectly made. Even just the simple mushroom-garlic-ham combinations are amazing and satisfying. I do have to say, though, I surprisingly preferred the sundaes over the dessert crepes! The Stone Age sundae is just.... indescribable, especially for nut lovers out there. I even took my Mom here, so you can imagine how cutesy this place is, and how good the food is :)

QtuVBdGuEm2qLYmTQ-p5Gw.text: Loved our breakfast here! I went for a sweet crepe while my boyfriend had a savory crepe. We both enjoyed them very much. It was a nice day out so we opted to sit outside. It was very pleasant and good for people watching since it's near the Underground station. Wish I could've eaten here again before we left.

qJ-WJTCx_Py7bX1a21NuxQ.text: Believe it or not, the only time I had crepes during my Europe trip including Paris, was only at this joint.  And although I'm sure Paris had way better ones, It was pretty darn good.While it was a little on the expensive side, we were able to share and indulge on a savory and sweet version to calm our morning hunger.  The crepes were definitely better than those in the states, and had a moist interior texture against the crisp exterior with a generous amount of filling in each.

TEK-MPVY5aw6TKpgcDabfQ.text: This place has the laziest people working there, and rude as well. We ordered an almond crepe and it did not arrive, instead they served the table next to us who came half an hour after we came. We had to go inside to ask where is the crepe?! No one seemed to be willing to help. We left without eating. Very bad experience.

6kY45CODIf4-jUbMoC3nFA.text: I got a buckwheat crepe...or should I say I ordered a buckwheat cracker? Because it was so crispy, it could've been a cracker.I got a chicken, mushroom and corn crepe. A bit on the buttery side, and most definitely the crepe was too well done. The place is tiny, the servers don't speak English either so when I needed to break my £20 note, she was confused for a whopping 5 minutes -- and annoyed at me, as if it were my fault. Super hot inside, service was slow (and the server was impatient). Food was overpriced for what I got, especially since it wasn't good (£8.10??) Wouldn't come again.

gpmWsb7kho-xjy660darKw.text: Screw my milkshake... these crêpes are what bring the boys to the yard. And they're like, "I'm better than yours. In fact, I'm the best dang sweet or savory creation in this entire playground of unhealthy goodness. So step d-o-w-n. Who the hell are you milkshake? Nobody."Whether you go sweet or savory, Nutella, buckwheat or strawberries and cream, they're so delicious that I advise not using hands or utensils. Just dive face first into that pancake-y goodness. Thank me later.

Vo5VH1-T8qbEHczNEDNGfQ.text: Naughty, just plain, unadulterated naughtiness on a plate. You'll pick up that bad-boy crepe and rub the sweet/savoury goodness right into your face.Resistance is futile.

wFeuRp43IBWKpk_YMfRcqA.text: This restaurant has a very nice atmosphere and the crepes - both sweet and savoury - are delicious. However the prices are on the high end, anywhere from £7-10 for one. The portions are quite big and filling. I would come back for the crepes but probably not often since I'm not rich.

6snaECWjFzP86_26HUbR5w.text: Absolutely loved this place in London. For some reason London was very hit and miss with restaurants but I loved this place their traditional crepe was the best Crepe I have had along with their tropical crepe for desert it is just around the corner from the natural history museum and I while I was studying in London this became my favorite spot

yKglJ3BRv2ktJ6bRxq51YA.text: I love crepes, and this is one place I return for more. I have eaten here a couple of times, but today I was a bit disappointed with my crepe with cheddar cheese. There wasn't enough of cheese and it was all concentrated to the centre. The corners was plain and tasted very bland. My friend ordered the vegetarian version of the Mona Lisa crepe which was good. Previously I had ham and cheese crepe and crepe with mushroom, cheese and spinach. Both were well made.

kcxK69mFio6IypC9eGM8fw.text: The crepe is good but the service is really disappointing. There is a board says "please wait here to be seated", so I just waited at the front door for about 10mins. The waitress saw me but she didn't do or say anything. Disappointed.

ghMkEo1FL0E9UoZCbmc0Ag.text: Love this place, Nutella & Banana Crepes with excellent coffee and a great view.  I can't wait to go back to this place the next time I'm in London.

udXz75BKgxDxyQNzVn-U8w.text: 'This experience was the tale of two sides'. 'Dry and Moist'.Value for money - yes. Service with a smile - yes. Authentic Taste - absolutely. Would I eat here again - I hope so.My eyes were bigger than my stomach on entering the creperie and I should have known better not to order two plates of some of Kensington's finest but I dare say I couldn't resist. I ordered both the caramel banana crepes and chocolate Belgian waffles with a side scoop of snickers ice cream and ferrer rocher. To cut a tasty mouth explosion short the waffle was fantastic. Moist, chocolate melting muddy, fresh and fluffy and delicious to boot ... Oh both of the scoops of ice cream hit the mark as well. Yet .... On the flip the crepes not so much. Dry and disappointing to put it bluntly. I was eying of the freshness of the girls sitting next to me and wished I was in her shoes and not mine. For the sake of a bad crepe day I'm still honouring this establishment with 4 lucky stars. The service was fantastic, a lively busy environment and the price whilst I thought was a little adventurous  was not enough to turn me off a re visit to this fab establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of Kensington Creperie - London, United Kingdom. Caramel Crepe Snickers Ice Cream Delight

9KpLupQJL8ZySd73JA-RHQ.text: This place is around the corner from South Kensington station. It's frequented by tourists and 'Euro' types. Not a place to linger for too long. No acknowledgement or any welcome on entry. They still charged me a 1.59 'service charge'. Tables are too close together and the place looks so tired and dated. The crepe itself was good and not too expensive at 4 pounds for a basic one with topping of choice for 89p each. I went with the honey topping.

photos.caption: Photo of Kensington Creperie - London, United Kingdom. Basic crepe with honey topping.

hyo69DhYc4C9gxEw-AWqYw.text: I had been there many times and the crepes quality as well as the choice used to be amazing. I went there again on 11th of June for dinner. What struck me was that the place was completely empty inside, something that would have never happened before (there always used to be queues to get a table). After sitting down I realised why -  what used to be 4 or 5 pages menu full of great and varied crepes turned into one page menu with a mere 8 savory crepes on the list (and three specials on the board). We were hesitant but finally decided to stay to check whether at least the quality is still there. Unfortunately, the crepe I ordered was mediocre. I also asked the waitress why the menu has been downgraded to a single page and she only explained that they have a new owner and that is what he wishes to have.It is really a pity that what used to be one of my favourite restaurants in London with great menu and selection of fantastic crepes turned into an average place. I will not be coming back.

pGczG2c-vOXC4OIvzdnKJQ.text: Yummy crepes, good service, was empty when we walked in on a Thursday around brunch time.

7T2_SEJnlNFoCozt2jgG0A.text: Terrible service, it took us ages to get seated, to get our order taken and our check. All of this would have been more reasonable given that they were understaffed since it was quite crowded except that it was all very confusing and brusque. They're probably still in business because it's near all the museums and who doesn't love crepes, especially when you're in South Kensington near Museum Row. Thought there was nothing particularly special about the crepes - I think they were tasty because we were hungry. I got whatever it was with the chicken and artichoke. "Meh, I've experienced better" is about right.

YQSRGeR5fNwyvcRydP5YZQ.text: I'm a little sorry to say that although I have walked by this place often for years, I have never thought to stop in, often opting for a quick drink or a bite to eat in the area and ignoring it completely. As of last night, I had officially arrived, hungry for something sweet with a gluttonous appetite and a crowd of dessert-fiend friends.This sweet little spot (see what I did there?) is very close to South Kensington station and Imperial College. We jumped at the chance to go after eating at Pierino (very close by). We arrived shortly before closing and were seated quickly and given menus. They have everything. EVERYTHING. Tons of sweet and savoury crepes, a large selection of waffles and ice creams (ice cream sundaes of all shapes and sizes, too). All you need to do is merely look at the menu (go on, it will take you a while) and you'll find just what you're looking for, whether you want a classic crepe with nutella or you want a waffle smothered in tropical fruits or you just want something savoury and warm to get you through the day. If you're a vegetarian, you will be in luck, too - there are plenty of choices and you won't struggle much unless you can't decide from the options in front of you. Best of luck with that!We ordered everything from waffles covered in nuts, chocolate and served with Ferrero Rocher ice cream (yumyumyum!) to crepes with chocolate, sugar and lemon, to custom made crepes with drunken apples, cinnamon and chocolate to classic glass bowls crammed with flavor after flavor of ice cream. Everything came quickly so we were able to dig in and soothe our cravings before things got too out of hand. The only gripe I have about this place is if you're asking about the ice cream flavors, you have to get up and figure it out yourself as they've got dozens (try the Snickers ice cream, too) and they're not all listed on the menu and your server isn't going to want to walk you through them all. Portions are big enough to share but you won't want to - everything is too good to spare a bite.

RhBIMPN6WLfT1szzKAMBgg.text: I had a terrible experience..1) Rude staff, waitress threw menu down on the table without even glancing in our direction. This attitude continued throughout the visit2) The 'fresh' smoothies are not fresh. The waitress only told me this after I asked what fruits they had because the original smoothie I wanted had apparently 'run out'. It transpired that the smoothies come from frozen bags. I was offered complimentary fresh strawberries on the side as an apology.3) The crepes are not great.4) Bill came and I was charged for the strawberries.... Which never appeared. I complained to the manager and in all honesty, seemed embarrassed by the situation and then only charged for the crepes. My experience was still marred by the terrible service I had received and the quality of the products that they serve.

jlyPldA4AN3q5AlMQt1SAA.text: First night in London and we just kind of stumbled upon this cute little Creperie. Their savory crepes were on point! I got the Italian savory crepe and it was one of the best crepes I've ever had in my life (and I worked at a French Creperie for a summer).

akwfZ86GbPw9jojrqXI-Vg.text: I think this place is best on a Saturday afternoon after lunch. The sweet (rather than savory) crepes stand out as the best thing on offer, though the waffle is quite good, too. I've had both with milk and dark chocolate, and I prefer milk - the crepe with milk chocolate and bananas is particularly good.The only issue I have with the place is that the staff can be unfriendly. The short, Spanish man picks up on my American accent every time I'm there, sure to hassle me in some way. Last time it was about confusion as to whether I wanted take-away or eat-in when I made my desire to take away very, very clear. Little does he know that I speak Spanish, and that one day I will let loose my verbal revenge in his native tongue.The price seems reasonable at around 5 pounds per crepe; the quality of the order is always high. It's busy and often a bit hectic inside, but still enjoyable as a place to grab a quick dessert.

_cuu3rXDb1Gkhak8t-nDCA.text: Honestly, I have never been let down by this creperie. Busy or empty (though it rarely is), the staff are very friendly and happy to offer advice on the daunting list of savory and sweet crepes. Each and every one is delicious, and they cater to both vegetarian and meat lovers! The wine list is short but satisfactory, and they also offer beer and cider, though no cocktails. Saving the best for last - their ice cream is all made on site and is DELICIOUS! The pear sorbet is a lovely light palette cleanser after an indulgent crepe.

ZwjcqaVYtXz7HCh3-L-_sg.text: This was a disappointment, I am sorry to say. Even if I ordered a crepés with buckwheat i didn't expect it to be dry, hard and tasteless. For that high a price I would expect to be amazed. And I was, by the lack of fresh fruits and that soft feeling you get in your soul when eating a really good crepes.Take a strawl down Porto Bello Road when theres a market and you'll find 5-6 different street venders with crepes five times as good at a third of the price.The place was loud and the staff seemed so busy trying to serve everyone (or what they were doing) that i felt like being in the middle of Indy 500 race track. A couple of shattered glassed I think shows the stress levels these guys were under. Not their fault, not at all. It all comes down to management and leadership.If I was the only one in the company with a bad experience, that'd be fine, but my girlfriend didn't seem to enjoy her crepés either. And the fact that they handed us our check right after we finished, without asking for it. Like: Please leave.Sorry guys. Do over, do better. They're in a great spot on a nice street and it could become a good place. With some effort.

XXBY5Q40Q1gbDYWsHaZNAQ.text: We came across this nice little place by accident and throughly enjoy ourselves. The staff was quick to serve us and the food was delicious. We will be back for the crepes as well as the fruit smoothies.

VQjTsSFAar-Abn38WlvCUw.text: Service sucks a big one. Food is okay if you don't order the Tandoori Dream. Water is going to cost you money. No option for free water. If the service was better I might be inclined to add another star.  With that said, I like the location and nice outdoor sitting.

-K2MT2WetE91H0U1iIjTEg.text: The service tries hard but most barely grasp English...A consequence I assume of the proximity to the University.   Meanwhile. ..too many crepe choices...literally 50+ to choose from.The crepes my wife and I enjoyed...peach & hazelnut were appropriately decadent and satisfied our sweet tooth but neither of us spent the next 10 minutes talking about it.   However, I fancy myself a mocha canoseur.   This creperie's mocha was outstanding though...perfect combo of coffe and sweet chocolate!

chi70H5BtyyFRteLblaMNg.text: Even if you're new to London, you've probably realized that South Kensington is jam packed with overpriced tourist traps where the servers are clearly weary of serving a combination of obnoxious foreigners, rowdy students and demanding Middle-Eastern royalty.  Unfortunantly, Cafe Creperie really is no exception.  First off, if you're at Cafe Creperie and it's before 18:00, STOP.  Stop right now and head back to the tube stop, because there is absolutely no reason for you not to be at Ben's Cookies just outside the station.Still reading? Okay, so it's after 18:00... bummer.  Are you dead-set on Crepes? Because if you're not and are willing to travel a stop or two, head to Scoop near both the Piccadilly Circus and Covent Garden stations.STILL reading? Damn.  Must be after 22:00 eh? Either that or you're reaaaallllly hungry.  Fine fine fine, go ahead and walk to Cafe Creperie.  It'll be obnoxiously crowded for the hour, and you likely won't walk out with less than a tener having fled your pocket, but you will have just had some decent portions at the very least.

c4XOZ7A3iIJpdGt-TEbnDw.text: Great place to get savory crapes and sweet crapes the customer service is fantastic and the lattes are awesome. Really a gem and reasonably price spot in the Kensington area.

photos.caption: Photo of Kensington Creperie - London, United Kingdom

NbLGOggbxVDrYK1ewZyhiA.text: Kensington Creperie is a cafe located near the South Kensington tube entrance. I came here for breakfast. They sell crepes, breakfast food, and espresso drinks. Crepes were decent, nothing note worthy. It's a convenient breakfast place, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.The creperie has decent amount of seating. Service was friendly.OrderedBanana nutella crepe - was decent. Bigger than i expected.

photos.caption: Photo of Kensington Creperie - London, United Kingdom

bKjlKNXggBrIX-XJJSW3IA.text: Made a good hazelnut latte however the wait staff are condescending. Would not return.

CXLeW3bMiD3sIcLfz989GA.text: You should eat here if it's convenient but certainly should NOT go out of your way to come here.  The staff was fine and the creeps we're okay.  I only stopped by here because it was close to the S. Kensington tube station.  I will say that I did enjoy my Rooibos tea, as it was my first experience drinking it.  I asked my waiter how this particular tea tasted and he just said its good and will go okay with your milk.  Very uninformative. Rooibos is a tea leaf from Africa with a full body nutty taste and I enjoyed it quite much. I'll be honest and say that part of this review was taken from my personal boiler plate template and slightly modified to help provide a slightly meaningful review relevant to this specific restaurant. I do this not because I'm lazy but rather because I feel this restaurant was a safe, solid, and a middle of the road restaurant.   I will walk away full but did not feel the food has left a lasting impression.

photos.caption: Photo of Kensington Creperie - London, United Kingdom. jolly good time ol' chap

qXEJJhIbiTHAnLTzT6dlJg.text: Very disappointed in this place. First, apparently they open at 9 and not 8:30 like this says. I walked in because the door was open and the chef was very friendly and helped me. Then another guy walked in and started barking about how they don't open until 9. I asked if they took credit cards, they said no the systems are down. So I just bailed on the place. If the experience is that bad without food, I don't want to eat there. Will never go back.

NI-gkZDiZyYcxO20zUKCoA.text: Busy crepe spot just across the street from the V&A and Natural history museums. The great point about the restaurant is it's location makes it the perfect spot to have a meal before heading in for an afternoon in a museum. The service is extremely friendly though it can be slow and the food is quite good! However, it's overpriced which was the big downside and the reason for a 3-star rating.

-Ut9vb7YXXzyTGIB4FzokA.text: This place is in a great location on a stretch of Exhibition Road a couple of blocks south of the Victoria and Albert Museum. The food and coffee are both great and the outdoor seating is wonderful on a nice day. The prices are also reasonable. The table service is pretty good and the personnel are quite friendly and pleasant. However, our experience suggested the kitchen staff might be overwhelmed a little too easily when things get busy.We had just finished our tour of the Victoria and Albert Museum. It was about 3:30 and we had not had lunch. We saw from TripAdvisor that there were several restaurants two blocks away on a short stretch of Exhibition Road that was largely dominated by pedestrian traffic. There were a number of excellent choices but this place stood out with an attractive exterior and a tantalizing specialty for its cuisine. The outdoor seating area was packed as It was surprisingly busy for the time of day but we chalked this up to the fact that it was a Bank Holiday. We were fortunate in our timing as there was only one other party ahead of us waiting to be seated. That group was larger and wanted to sit inside. Hence, when an outside table became available, we were seated within a minute or two of our arrival. We observed that seating became more difficult during the course of our visit.Our server waited on us right away. She appeared to be one of the proprietors and was rather pleasant and very friendly. The staff were flying around frantically at times trying to take care of the numerous patrons. In all they were doing a pretty decent job in a challenging situation even if they seemed slightly disorganized at times.We placed our order and received our Sparkling Water very quickly followed by the crepe ordered by my colleague in a very reasonable amount of time. However, when they delivered the first crepe, I was told the crepe I ordered was coming. Unfortunately, after fifteen minutes or so it had still not arrived. At this time, our server came back and asked how we had enjoyed our food. I let her know I was still waiting on my crepe. She offered a sincere apology and a menacing scowl came across her face as she looked back toward the kitchen. She went back inside to have a word with someone and my crepe appeared about three or four minutes later. I appreciated the quick rectification but it was clear to me that things had reached a tipping point for them and the helter-skelter was getting the best of them.As far as the food was concerned, however, we could not have been happier with our selections once they were delivered. At the recommendation of our server, my colleague selected the La Belle Hélène, a sweet crepe featuring a pear, dark Belgian chocolate, almond flakes, vanilla ice cream and real whipped cream. She let me try it and it was absolutely luscious. I chose a savory crepe on the other hand deciding to try the Countryside, which was filled with chicken, onion, spinach, garlic, carrot and cheddar cheese. It was likewise excellent and was also quite filling. We finished with coffees which were done very nicely.The prices were not bad for what we received and considering it was centre city London. The total bill was £29.48, everything included. This was about $46 USD at the exchange rate at the time, or about $23 per person. In an expensive city like London, this sort of pricing was not unexpected. And we certainly got our money's worth considering the quality of the fare.Overall, while there were some hiccups in service due to the busyness at the time we were there, this place was a great find. The crepes and coffee both were excellent, the personnel were polite and pleasant and the atmosphere was lovely. The prices were not bad considering the location and the quality of the fare. If you like crepes and outdoor cafes, this is a great choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Kensington Creperie - London, United Kingdom. Kensington Creperie
Photo of Kensington Creperie - London, United Kingdom. Countryside Crepe at Kensington Creperie
Photo of Kensington Creperie - London, United Kingdom. La Belle Helene at Kensington Creperie

IgtIJfyNF5kcoWzxUSOvzg.text: Kensington CreperieSouth Kensington, LondonHmm.. where shall I start? Disappointing is an understatement. Terrible is an understatement. Worse crepe place in London is an understatement. So maybe an amalgamation of all the above??The service was awful. We had to wait 45 minutes for crepes. They got mine wrong -simple instruction "no cheese"! The waitress literally threw the plate at me and walked off while I was still asking for cutlery. I had to physically carry the wrong crepe back to the counter as the lovely waitress kept on ignoring me.  When the right crepe arrived, it tasted awful - dry crepe with very uninspired filling. I couldn't eat it!overall, do not go there. Awful, awful experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Kensington Creperie - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Kensington Creperie - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Kensington Creperie - London, United Kingdom

J7Pa_QwooY29xA3PukyRew.text: Really good savoury crepes! They all look the same from the outside when they are served, but mmm the filling was different and delicious for both of the savoury crepes I have tried here. I think the beef ragu is my favourite as it's not a flavour I have found elsewhere and it is really yummy, but the Countryside with chicken,garlic and spinach and added potatoes was also great. The menu has a lot of great options and you can choose your own fillings which is great. I really love the iced coffee latte here as well. The KC hot chocolate is maybe too laced with cinnamon flavour for me, but it was nice. I definitely plan to come back sometime to try the dessert menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Kensington Creperie - London, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of Kensington Creperie - London, United Kingdom. Delicious beef ragu crepe!
Photo of Kensington Creperie - London, United Kingdom. KC hot chocolate with cinnamon flavour

6Gftt8DEmTxmrWu3eWspLA.text: Crepes who does not like it .. Everyone likes crepe .. This cafe is really one of the best crepe in london .. I had try this shop several times .. The crepe in this shop is fresh an tasty they have many selection of crepes and waffles to .. Such as milk chocolate , dark chocolate , banana with chocolate , scopes of ice cream served with crepes or waffles .. When o want to this store they had cancel the white chocolate I felt sad ... Because it was my fav .. ,plus they have hot drinks latte , chocolate and expresso .. Staff are friendly & lovely .. Prices was reasonable

photos.caption: Photo of Kensington Creperie - London, United Kingdom

5KkhlX27ePL8p-XX-6xghA.text: Delicious. Great place to relax and enjoy. Service was excellent and the food was very good.

pbQz1uATH5x2vj3Q1tOaYQ.text: As it's Kensington, they're on the pricey side. The seating is on the uncomfortable side, so this is not a place to linger. Staff are friendly and helpful. And oooohhhh, their selection of crepes! They have savoury and sweet ones, regular and deluxe toppings, anything you could want. Their crepes are super fresh and all toppings were top quality as well.I'd give them a higher rating if their seating was more comfortable. I also find pricing a little too steep for what it is. In the area it's a great place for a light lunch though.

vNBEEf8Q8Uyr_0VM9V1Vaw.text: This is one place I will never forget... I stubbed in five years ago when I was visiting London to get a crepe... And had to go back this time when I visited. I took my mom and we each had a great and the best cappuccino that we've ever had. This place is amazing and I highly recommend for anyone visiting London. It is right by the Kensington metro stop.

photos.caption: Photo of Kensington Creperie - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Kensington Creperie - London, United Kingdom

I5uzcdjT26s7H5QLt65nXg.text: The crepes were ok (not amazing like in other crêperies I've been to), but the service was rushed and borderline rude.

3tC20iVI9sL2fLjFPVi-lQ.text: Crepe was only alright...Walk in without being greeted. Sat ourselves down, see the staff talk amongst themselves on who would be serving out table. 15 minutes later, finally placed our order. Things were missing when they came out. No ice cream, no coffee spoon, no silverware at the table. Took another 15 to get the bill. The waitress disappeared for a while. As we leave cash on the table and leave, I think the manager proceeds to stop us and tell us we didn't pay. Terrible experience. Not going back.

9Zr80CvRAnMfHOFISXhlzQ.text: Great location.  The food was fantastically delicious and served quickly.  Great staff too!  While I was waiting as the sign indicated to be seated, someone chose to just sit down at the table I had my eye on.  When the waitress noticed what had happened she gave me a free gelato for my trouble, which was completely unnecessary, but extremely appreciated.  Will definitely go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Kensington Creperie - London, United Kingdom

UvrezWm02Nj9FJmTin59gw.text: Next to South Kensington station and very close to Hyde Park in London, this is a lovely place to eat delicious crepes. Given you can get a delicious meal for £9, as long as you earn in pounds, you can call that a bargain. It is a well served crepe portion and the only downside I would mention about this place is the fact that it only accepts cash. These days when you can pay virtually anything with a card, I find a bit nonsense that you cannot do it in a restaurant. They also have lovely options for desert. I highly recommend this play but I also suggest to avoid lunch hours, since that's when you get the peaks of visitors and you may end up facing a very long queue in order to manage to get a table.

photos.caption: Photo of Kensington Creperie - London, United Kingdom

txuZJ5Pf7iLblQ-MZf3EiA.text: I had a smoked salmon and spinach crepe, or rather, what I thought was a crepe.I should have trusted my instincts the moment I walked into the dingy place and saw the cook make a crepe on the crepe pan with an **incredible** amount of oil.My crepe arrived rather greasy and very crispy, which of course is a product of having it FRIED in grease. Crepes are meant to be slightly chewy and delicate but this was none of that. I would say calling it a crepe is a wee bit of a misnomer. More like a very fried thin pancake with filling.The smoked salmon and spinach had cheese inside which made it a little salty. I was starving but didn't finish my "crepe".They have a very wide selection of sweet and savory crepes. It is better in my opinion to be master of a few crepes than to be a jack of all crepes. Come here if you are easily satisfied. Otherwise, avoid this place. My "crepe" cost 8.5 quid.

UQ2K9ABq8YQNDEqtuuVnBg.text: Good crepes, made ans served by a French team, but very long service. Be prepared to wait. Well located near the station and nice ambiance. Only issue was the long service.

photos.caption: Photo of Kensington Creperie - London, United Kingdom

Jyw911JllkdZBhwa_myiDw.text: Very very thick crepes. We came here for a Saturday morning breakfast. My husband had a chicken pesto crepe. Chicken quality was horrible and it smelled and was too big. I had the hazel bania crepe of something. Was good but the crepe was so thick and layered. Had never seen that before. Color also seemed off. Latte was extremely cold. Have never had a latte that cold between our Paris and London trip. Will look else where as the prices were a bit much. We paid around 30-35 pounds for a breakfast of two for tw crepes and tw drinks
